question_text: What happens in a switch when two devices are detected using the same MAC address?
answer_options: The switch logs an ARP mismatch and forwards both
The switch shuts down the port to prevent spoofing
The switch dynamically assigns a new MAC address
The switch allows the newer device only on VLAN 1
correct_answer: The switch shuts down the port to prevent spoofing
explanation: Switches often include MAC security features such as port security, which can disable ports when duplicate MAC addresses are detected to prevent spoofing.
